Situated among the picturesque valleys of central Honshu's famous Alps region, Azumino boasts a unique blend of culture, history and natural beauty.

value: directions=Next to the railway station on the north side of the square
hours=0900-1700 (April–November); 1000-1600 (December–March). Closed during New Year Holidays
content=They have a number of useful English brochures for Azumino and the wider region.

Take the JR Chuo East line from Shinjuku to Matsumoto, then the JR Oito line to Hotaka or the JR Shinonoi line to Akashina (3 hrs, ￥6620 unreserved seat)
Take the Nagano Shinkansen to Nagano, JR Shinonoi line to Akashina (2 hrs 30 mins, ￥9,390 unreserved seat)
Take the JR Chuo West line to Matusmoto, then the JR Oito line to Hotaka  (2 hrs 15 minutes, ￥5,670 unreserved seat)
Take the Shinonoi line from Nagano station to Akashina station
Take the Chuo Expressway west to Oyaka Junction then the Nagano Expressway and exit at Toyoshina.
Take the Chuo Expressway east to Oyaka Junction then the Nagano Expressway and exit at Toyoshina.
Take the Nagano Expressway and exit at Toyoshina
Hire bicycles from the Hitsujiya Cafe across the square from the railway station. Tel: 0263-82-3888

value: name=Daio Wasabi Farm and Water Mills
alt=大王わさび農場と水車小屋
directions=Turn west off route 147 opposite the Honda dealer and follow the road until you reach the farm
price=Activities include make your own wasabi pickle for ￥1000

content=Founded in 1915 and known as the largest wasabi farm in Japan, with a long history and a picturesque setting. The water mills next to the farm can be viewed by taking one of the special raft tours that are available in spring and summer.
directions=Go south on route 147 from the Hotaka Station intersection. Take the first on the left. The residence is about 400m along, on the right.
content=A hunting lodge used by a local lord in the Edo Period.
directions=Go west on route 30 from the Hakuyacho intersection for about 800m then turn left.
content=A cluster of various local cultural establishments including glasswork, photography, a cafe, a soba restaurant and vegetable market.
directions=Walk straight out of the railway station and down the street for about 100m. Look for the large torii gate on the right

content=The god Hokatami-no-Mikoto, the guardian deity of the region, is worshipped here. If you think you have seen plenty of shrines in Japan, this one will still surprise you with its main shrine building which is at least 100m long. Festivals include The Obisha (bow and arrow) Festival on March 17, and the Festival of Floats on the 26th (evening) and 27th September. Hokatami-no-Mikato is famous as the guardian deity of industries and traffic safety on land and sea. You can buy a prayer charm for 3000 yen (motocycles), 4000-5000 yen (regular cars) or 6000 yen (large vehicles).
name=Azumino Kisen Hot Air Balloon Rides
price=Adults ￥24,000, High School age and below ￥16,000
content=Hot air balloon flights from December to March
directions=10 minutes walk from Hotaka Station
content=Japanese sweets made from local apples, chestnuts, walnuts and so on.
directions=On route 321, about 400m south of the Sumiyoshi intersection
directions=On Route 147, one block south of the intersection with route 317
content=Izakaya serving sushi and soba. Try the Azumino sushi roll with Shinshu salmon and mountain potatoes
directions=Off route 147, about 600m east of the Sumiyoshi intersection
content=Italian cuisine with a view of the Alps.
alt=ペンションメープルリーフ
directions=From Hotaka station, go west on route 308, cross route 25, and continue for another 300m.
price=From ￥8,400 per person with two meals
content=A boutique hotel built in Tudor style, with twin rooms, onsen and English speaking staff.
- Explore the onsens, mountains and temples of this small city straddling the picturesque Chikuma River
- Check out the famous black castle
— home to Shiga Kogen, Japan's largest ski resort
